column4: need some help getting my video card to work properly.  ubuntu 9.10 32bit
please
What is not working about it?
nvidia?
Does it help if you disable desktop effects?
Can you try booting with radeon.modeset=1 as a kernel parameter to enable KMS?
You should try entering it at the grub prompt first so it will only be active for that session
If it helps, then upgrading to 10.04 should help since KMS is now the default for radeon
Did you have static windows issue?
Well that was using kms already so try asking in #radeon or filing a bug report. A screenshot might also help clarify the issue
you thin the KMS is already running then?
On 9.10, no it is UMS as default
You have to register your nick name
If you had the same issue in 10.04, I doubt enbleing modeset will help since KMS is default in 10.04
I asked you if you had the static window issue in 10.04 and you said yes
Ok, when grub loads, press esc then highlight ubuntu and press e to edit
Then, you will want to append the option on the kernel line after ro quiet splash
so it will look like kernel root=blah blah ro quiet splash radeon.modeset=1
You mean two x sessions on different tty's or two separate X screens?
I upgraded to 10.04 and it solved the issues I was having with the video card.  But, now I want to run a separate x-session on each monitor.
Ah yes, just define two X screens in your xorg.conf which you'll probably want two device and monitor sections as well (for each screen)
